lines.text:
[to Peter]
There is a smell of brimstone about you.
You have no reason to be afraid of him.
No more reason than I have to fear a graveyard at night.
You're sort of a mystery man even to your friends.

[after running a Geiger counter over him]
Your count's a trifle high, Dr. Forsythe.
Don't worry about it till I glow after dark.
